messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re:up-dates

messages.messageBody:

<< ***Updates would be a GREAT idea -- but, I had my nephew do my web-page,
and
I can only add links. >>

You could add a link to a page that someone else puts updates on then (or
that you do) so that they can click "what's new" or something! (if you wanted to)

Sandra

messages.subject: Duh! Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re:up-dates
messages.msgSnippet: I ll read slower next time. Grad school. But I d still be interested in which schools.
messages.messageBody:
I'll read slower next time. Grad school. But I'd still be interested in
which schools.

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re:up-dates
messages.msgSnippet: ... Connie - besides NYU and UCLA, can you share which other schools he auditioned at. My dd is heading that way and we re starting to do a bit of research.
messages.messageBody:
on 3/5/04 9:31 AM, conniecolten@... at conniecolten@... wrote:

> A note about the grad school -- Shawn was here in Feb to audition to two
> schools, and then did NYU, then back here for two more. After he did UCLA he
> called me and was SO excited. He simply knew it went well, and there was a
> connection. He decided to cancel the audition he had scheduled at Yale in a
> couple
> weeks.


Connie - besides NYU and UCLA, can you share which other schools he
auditioned at. My dd is heading that way and we're starting to do a bit of
research. Also, did I read correctly that he was a transfer student and not
applying as a homeschooler?

Thanks,
Paula

messages.subject: Re:up-dates
messages.msgSnippet: ... ***Updates would be a GREAT idea -- but, I had my nephew do my web-page, and I can only add links.  I love Steven, but getting him to DO any more on my
messages.messageBody:
> But updates? Are you going to keep an updates section?


***Updates would be a GREAT idea -- but, I had my nephew do my web-page, and
I can only add links. I love Steven, but getting him to DO any more on my
site is DIFFICULT!!!! I'll ask him tho ---

A note about the grad school -- Shawn was here in Feb to audition to two
schools, and then did NYU, then back here for two more. After he did UCLA he
called me and was SO excited. He simply knew it went well, and there was a
connection. He decided to cancel the audition he had scheduled at Yale in a couple
weeks. He was worried his car wouldn't make it (9hrs each way), and felt he'd
be better served working and getting more money!

Connie

>
>




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
